unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about planning a wedding and remembering all the dates, right? Well, let me tell you, it’s a proper juggle! My cousin, Priya, got married last year, and the whole family was running around like headless chickens. First, there was the engagement on 12/05/2023. Then, the Haldi ceremony was scheduled for 02/08/2024 at 10:00 AM. Honestly, I was just making chai for everyone, but I was still stressed!
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about planning a wedding and remembering all the dates, right? Well, let me tell you, it's a proper juggle! My cousin, Priya, got married last year, and the whole family was running around like headless chickens. First, there was the engagement on twelfth May two thousand and twenty three. Then, the Haldi ceremony was scheduled for second August two thousand and twenty four at ten A-M. Honestly, I was just making chai for everyone, but I was still stressed!

unnormalised: Then came the actual wedding date: 03/08/2024. We started prepping at 4:00 AM! The pandit ji wanted specific timings for everything, like the pheras at precisely 11:15 AM. Between remembering the dates for booking the venue (months in advance!) and coordinating all the vendors, I needed a spreadsheet just to keep track of it all. We even had a pre-wedding shoot scheduled for 2 weeks prior, on 20/07/2024.
normalised: Then came the actual wedding date: third August two thousand and twenty four. We started prepping at four A-M! The pandit ji wanted specific timings for everything, like the pheras at precisely eleven fifteen A-M. Between remembering the dates for booking the venue (months in advance!) and coordinating all the vendors, I needed a spreadsheet just to keep track of it all. We even had a pre-wedding shoot scheduled for two weeks prior, on twentieth July two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Honestly, the best advice I can give is to delegate! Priya's friend took charge of keeping track of all the events leading up to the big day. Without her, we'd probably have missed the deadline for sending out the invitations, which had to be done by 15/06/2024. So, find someone you trust to help you manage the dates, times, and deadlines – it’ll save you a lot of headaches!
normalised: Honestly, the best advice I can give is to delegate! Priya's friend took charge of keeping track of all the events leading up to the big day. Without her, we'd probably have missed the deadline for sending out the invitations, which had to be done by fifteenth June two thousand and twenty four. So, find someone you trust to help you manage the dates, times, and deadlines – it’ll save you a lot of headaches!
